name: places/ChIJpUb-Twj0wokRJiPCibUNass
formattedAddress: 228 Nagle Ave, New York, NY 10034, USA
adrFormatAddress: 228 Nagle Ave, New York, NY 10034-6082, USA

originalText.text:
DON‚ÄôT GO TO THIS PLACE. I recently moved to this area and the closest laundry is this one. I‚Äôve been  taking my clothes to this exact location for them to wash it. About 2 months ago when I picked up my clothes and went to check them, all the white and grey clothes were stained in a different color (light pink and orange). I went to the laundry about 5 days after the incident and told them what happened, they said they couldn‚Äôt help me because it was days after already. They told me that if this issue were to happen again, they would give me a free wash or in cash the value of the pieces ruined. The next washing I took my clothes like normal, obviously expecting a good service. In this specific washing I told the lady at the front that I had delicate pieces in a blue bag to please be careful, I repeated this twice, and she said to not worry that she would wash it herself. I went 2 days later to pick up my laundry. Something told me to check my clothes since they were hesitating to give me the blue bag that had the delicate pieces. SAME thing happens again. I had a very special white dress that hold a special memory, and this dress was now totally stained pink, when it should be white. I was very upset and asked to speak to the manager. They told me that for any issue or refunds I would have to wait for the manager which wasn't in that day. At this point I was a bit aggravated and I just felt like they weren't owning up to the fact that I specifically had stated the issue when I walked in. The worse thing about this situation is how bad I was treated and how rude they were to me. The lady told me that it was my fault I didn't clasify the clothes before giving it to her, and that she wasn't aware that if she put all the clothes together, they would stain.They never said sorry and never owned to fact of what I had said prior to this. I left without my clothes and told them to please not touch them until I could go the next day and speak to the manager. After 15 minutes of being home I thought about maybe just taking my clothes how they were, and just getting a picture incase the manager wanted proof. When I walk in again and ask for this, they tell me that they can't give me my clothes because they're trying to fix it. My dress was a in a separate washing machine with whitening detergent, when I clearly said to please leave it as is. As I try to explain to them again, they said that they will give me the money, that what else do I want, that my dress could just be trashed and they'll pay for it. After moments of me asking to please just give me my clothes, they gave me the 2 bags in a very rude way, still not apologizing for any of this. I went back before heading to work the next morning, same lady was there, ignored me as I walked in and just said, manager is not here and not sure when he will be.
Btw, the employee name is Mercedes and another lady

originalText.text: The staff at this location leaves something to be desired. I went in on the 24th of December to check the hours of operation. It said it closes at 7pm, at 6pm I brought a few things in to wash and one of the staff told me I could not wash because the last load was to be done at 4:30pm. I then proceeded to ask why was that not  specified on the door with the other information. She then became rude and told me I could not wash and had to leave. I then asked for the contact information for the lady that is over the establishment and I was told there is no woman that she is the only one there over the business. I then  described with the woman looked like and asked for her contact information again and was told ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not giving you anything.‚Äù I then explained that I can retrieve the information from off line. I then asked her for her name, I was then told, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not giving you nothing‚Äù. I understand establishments will be closing early on these days but proper  advertisement is a huge part of good business, as well as good employees. This establishment is a bit to expensive for what and where it is to have  uncouth employees, especially  when there are so many other competitors in the area.  I would affirm they recommend to all others to take your money else where.

originalText.text: Workers are very rude, especially Mercedes. They stain your clothes because they don‚Äôt classify the clothes by color, and they don‚Äôt even apologize. They treat you like it‚Äôs your fault. DO NOT BRING YOUR CLOTHES HERE!

text.text: Workers are very rude, especially Mercedes. They stain your clothes because they don‚Äôt classify the clothes by color, and they don‚Äôt even apologize. They treat you like it‚Äôs your fault. DO NOT BRING YOUR CLOTHES HERE!

originalText.text:
This is a great place. Clean, roomy, lots of assorted size washers and a whole backside of dryers.
Today was a horrible afternoon as the women who are attending the laundromat allowed their family/friends to take on the WHOLE left side of washers and then ALL of the dryers. People were straining to fold their clothes as they also took up ALL of the folding stations.
The dryers only had three to four items a piece. When the cycle was completed, they would not remove their clothing items for others to use the dryer. When asked to do so, they were upset as they were interrupted from their conversations. When the attendants were informed, they never approached them.
One can not run a business allowing your employees to bring in friends/family to swamp your place during primetime. üòíüòêüòë

The workers hardly speak English!  I have always used the bathroom even with the closed sign on it! Now today it‚Äôs closed
